items.label: thm-permutation-symmetry
items.title: Permutation Invariance
items.content:
250: :label: thm-permutation-symmetry
251: 
252: The Geometric Gas transition operator $\Psi$ is **exactly invariant** under the action of the symmetric group $S_N$. For any permutation $\sigma \in S_N$:
253: 
254: $$
255: \Psi(\sigma(\mathcal{S}_t), \cdot) = \sigma \circ \Psi(\mathcal{S}_t, \cdot)
256: 
257: $$
258: 
259: Equivalently, the transition kernel satisfies:
260: 
261: $$
262: P(\mathcal{S}_{t+1} | \mathcal{S}_t) = P(\sigma(\mathcal{S}_{t+1}) | \sigma(\mathcal{S}_t))
263: 
264: $$
items.raw_directive:
247: The most fundamental symmetry is the **exchangeability** of walkers.

items.label: thm-translation-equivariance
items.title: Conditional Translation Equivariance
items.content:
347: :label: thm-translation-equivariance
348: 
349: Suppose the reward function $R(x, v)$ and domain $\mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}$ satisfy:
350: 
351: $$
352: R(x + a, v) = R(x, v), \quad x + a \in \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}} \iff x \in \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}
353: 
354: $$
355: 
356: for some $a \in \mathbb{R}^d$. Then the transition operator is **translation-equivariant**:
357: 
358: $$
359: \Psi(T_a(\mathcal{S}), \cdot) = T_a \circ \Psi(\mathcal{S}, \cdot)
360: 
361: $$
items.raw_directive:

items.label: thm-rotation-equivariance
items.title: Rotational Equivariance
items.content:
416: :label: thm-rotation-equivariance
417: 
418: Suppose:
419: 1. The domain is rotationally symmetric: $Rx \in \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}} \iff x \in \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}$ for all $R \in SO(d)$
420: 2. The reward is rotation-invariant: $R(Rx, Rv) = R(x, v)$ for all $R \in SO(d)$
421: 
422: Then the Geometric Gas is **rotationally equivariant**:
423: 
424: $$
425: \Psi(\mathcal{R}(\mathcal{S}), \cdot) = \mathcal{R} \circ \Psi(\mathcal{S}, \cdot)
426: 
427: $$
items.raw_directive:

items.label: thm-fitness-scaling
items.title: Fitness Potential Scaling Symmetry
items.content:
484: :label: thm-fitness-scaling
485: 
486: The fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}$ is **scale-invariant** under simultaneous rescaling of the exponents and floor parameter. Specifically, for any $c > 0$:
487: 
488: $$
489: V_{\text{fit}}[\alpha, \beta, \eta](x, v, S) = V_{\text{fit}}[c\alpha, c\beta, \eta^c](x, v, S)^{1/c}
490: 
491: $$
items.raw_directive:

items.label: thm-irreversibility
items.title: Time-Reversal Asymmetry
items.content:
527: :label: thm-irreversibility
528: 
529: The Geometric Gas is **not time-reversible**. There exists no time-reversal operator $\mathcal{T}$ such that:
530: 
531: $$
532: \mathcal{T} \circ \Psi \circ \mathcal{T}^{-1} = \Psi^{-1}
533: 
534: $$
items.raw_directive:
524: Unlike conservative physical systems, the Geometric Gas is **irreversible**.
